name: GetZoomRecordingAnalytics
description:
Retrieve analytics details for Zoom meeting or webinar recordings.

Use this tool to obtain detailed analytics for a Zoom meeting or webinar recording, covering data up to one month. Requires appropriate permissions.

parameters.name: meeting_or_webinar_id
parameters.description: Provide the meeting or webinar ID/UUID to retrieve cloud recordings. Double encode UUIDs starting with '/' or containing '//'.

value_schema.description:
To get a meeting's cloud recordings, provide the meeting ID or meeting UUID. If the meeting ID is provided instead of UUID, the response will be for the latest meeting instance. 

To get a webinar's cloud recordings, provide the webinar ID or the webinar UUID. If the webinar ID is provided instead of UUID, the response will be for the latest webinar instance. 

If a UUID starts with `/` or contains `//`, like `/ajXp112QmuoKj4854875==`, you must **double encode** the UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: records_per_page
parameters.description: The number of analytics records to return in one API call. Adjust for batch size.

value_schema.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: A token for navigating through pages of large result sets. It expires 15 minutes after retrieval.

value_schema.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the monthly range to query, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Defaults to current date if not provided.

value_schema.description: The start date for the monthly range to query. The maximum range can be a month. If you do not provide this value, this defaults to the current date.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date for the queried monthly range. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. The duration can't exceed one month from the start date.

value_schema.description: The end date for the monthly range to query. The maximum range can be a month.

parameters.name: analytics_detail_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of analytics details to retrieve: 'by_view' for view-based details or 'by_download' for download-based details.

value_schema.description:
The type of analytics details: 
* `by_view` — by_view. 
* `by_download` — by_download.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Zoom Meetings API.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

value_schema.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

value_schema.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start date for the monthly range to query. The maximum range can be a month. If you do not provide this value, this defaults to the current date.

value_schema.description: The start date for the monthly range to query. The maximum range can be a month. If you do not provide this value, this defaults to the current date.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end date for the monthly range to query. The maximum range can be a month.

value_schema.description: The end date for the monthly range to query. The maximum range can be a month.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of analytics details: 
* `by_view` — by_view. 
* `by_download` — by_download.

value_schema.description:
The type of analytics details: 
* `by_view` — by_view. 
* `by_download` — by_download.

parameters.name: meetingId
parameters.description:
To get a meeting's cloud recordings, provide the meeting ID or meeting UUID. If the meeting ID is provided instead of UUID, the response will be for the latest meeting instance. 

To get a webinar's cloud recordings, provide the webinar ID or the webinar UUID. If the webinar ID is provided instead of UUID, the response will be for the latest webinar instance. 

If a UUID starts with `/` or contains `//`, like `/ajXp112QmuoKj4854875==`, you must **double encode** the UUID before making an API request.

value_schema.description:
To get a meeting's cloud recordings, provide the meeting ID or meeting UUID. If the meeting ID is provided instead of UUID, the response will be for the latest meeting instance. 

To get a webinar's cloud recordings, provide the webinar ID or the webinar UUID. If the webinar ID is provided instead of UUID, the response will be for the latest webinar instance. 

If a UUID starts with `/` or contains `//`, like `/ajXp112QmuoKj4854875==`, you must **double encode** the UUID before making an API request.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
